1.text: Place your choice of chicken into a large pot.

2.text: Pour in enough cold water or stock to cover the chicken.

3.text: Put a handful of fresh herbs into the pot.

4.text: Add a variety of vegetables to create a rich flavor.

5.text: Customize the flavor of the chicken by adding spices.

6.text: Boil a whole chicken for 80 to 90 minutes.

7.text: Cook the chicken breasts for 15 to 30 minutes.

8.text: Boil chicken legs for 30 to 40 minutes.

9.text: Cook chicken thighs in the boiling liquid for 30 to 45 minutes.

10.text: Remove the boiled chicken and serve it while it's hot.

11.text: Use forks if you'd like to shred the chicken.

12.text: Chop or slice the chicken to make even pieces.

13.text: Store the boiled chicken in the refrigerator for up to 3 to 4 days.
